#memReq memLim ratio.messageLower: Memory request is significantly below the desired ratio to the limit.

#memLim memReq diff.messageUpper: Memory request is significantly below the desired difference from the limit.

CPUr cpuReq ratio.messageLower: CPU usage is significantly below the desired ratio to the request, not enough load?
CPUr cpuReq ratio.messageUpper: CPU usage is significantly above the allowed ratio to the request, too much load?

#memUse memLim ratio.messageLower: Memory usage vs limit ratio is very low, not enough load?
#memUse memLim ratio.messageUpper: Memory usage vs limit ratio is very high, running low on RAM? Or just kernel cache?

#memLim memUse diff.messageLower: Memory limit minus usage difference is very low, running low on RAM? Or just the kernel cache?
#memLim memUse diff.messageUpper: Memory limit minus usage difference is very high, not enough load?

RSS memLim ratio.messageLower: Memory RSS vs limit ratio is very low, not enough load? Or used by kernel cache?
RSS memLim ratio.messageUpper: Memory RSS vs limit ratio is very high, running low on RAM?

#memLim RSS diff.messageLower: Memory limit minus RSS difference is very low, running low on RAM?
#memLim RSS diff.messageUpper: Memory limit minus RSS difference is very high, not enough load? Or used by kernel cache?
